article.headline: Texas Tech 103, Georgia Southern 79
article.story: LUBBOCK, Texas -- David Tairu scored a career-high 22 points to lead five Texas Tech players in double figures as the Red Raiders beat Georgia Southern 103-79 in the South Padre Invitational on Tuesday night. Freshman Javarez Willis added 18 points while John Roberson had 17 for Texas Tech (4-1). Ben Drayton III led the Eagles (2-3) with 23 points while Cameron Baskerville finished with 11 points and 13 rebounds. Tairu hit three 3-pointers, and the Red Raiders never trailed after his first gave them a 5-3 lead. Texas Tech had struggled early in games this season but shot 50 percent in the first half of this one and hit 12 of 15 free throws to take a 49-38 halftime lead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
